member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cIMAPClient.Connect
member.summary: Connect to the using the . Can only be called while unconnected: see . Will throw if an authenticated IMAP connection cannot be established.

remarks.para: TLS is established if possible before authentication is attempted. TLS can be established immediately upon connect if the specifies or after connecting using the IMAP STARTTLS command if both the client and server support it - see , and .
During authentication the will be set. (Note that the value is used to determine what actual capabilities are used by the client - see .)

After authentication depending on what the allow;
RFC 6855 (UTF8) is enabled (see , ).
ID (RFC 2971) information is exchanged (see and ).
Namespace (RFC 2342) information is retrieved from the server (see ).
IMAP LIST is used to discover the hierarchy delimiter and one personal namespace is generated using it (see ).
(Note normally only one of Namespace and LIST are used: but under some strange circumstances both may be used [specifically if the Namespaces returned do not contain the inbox].)
At the end of a successful connect process the will be .

Exceptions relating to authentication and their meanings;
Was able to try credentials from but they didn't work. (If the is set the server explicitly rejected the credentials.)
Was not able to try any credentials from .
The server suggests that we try a different server (see and ).

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.sStoreFeedbackSummary
member.summary: Contains a summary of feeback on a store operation.

remarks.para: Each message counts towards ONE of;
Generally + is the number of definite non-updates.
Generally > 0 indicates that a may be worth trying to get any pending updates (which should convert all the notreflects to expunged or reflects).
Note that after a you should get the summary again using or
> 0 indicates that a blind update was done so there isn't enough information to say if the store happened or not.

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox
member.summary: Provides an API that allows interaction with an IMAP mailbox.

remarks.para: Instances are only valid whilst the containing remains connected. Reconnecting the client will not bring mailbox instances back to life.

To interact with messages in a mailbox, IMAP requires that the mailbox be selected - use the method of this class to select the mailbox associated with the instance. Each IMAP connection (and hence each instance) can have at most one selected mailbox selecting a mailbox automatically un-selects the previously selected mailbox. An instance of this class may be selected and un-selected many times in its lifetime. Each time an instance is selected a new select session is started. instances are valid only within a 'select session'.

member.summary: Indicates if the associated mailbox has been marked "interesting" by the server. Null indicates that the server didn't say either way. See the IMAP \Marked and \Unmarked flags.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.IsRemote
member.summary: Indicates if the associated mailbox is a remote mailbox. May be null if this can't be determined.
member.remarks:
Null will be returned under the following set of circumstances;
The instance has set to true.
The connected server supports .
The connected server does not support .
Under these circumstances it is not possible to reliably determine if the associated mailbox is remote or not.

member.summary: Gets the number of messages in the associated mailbox. May be null (see ). This property always has an up-to-date value when the associated mailbox is selected.
member.remarks: Null indicates that is not being cached (see ) or that the value was not sent when requested.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.RecentCount
member.summary: Gets the number of messages in the associated mailbox. May be null (see ). This property always has an up-to-date value when the associated mailbox is selected.
member.remarks: Null indicates that is not being cached (see ) or that the value was not sent when requested.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.UIDNext
member.summary: Gets the predicted next UID for the associated mailbox. May be null (see ). This property always has a value when the associated mailbox is selected, but it may not be up-to-date.

remarks.para: Null indicates that is not being cached (see ) or that the value was not sent when requested.
When the associated mailbox is selected, 0 indicates that the value is unknown.
While the associated mailbox is selected the value of this property may not be up-to-date: see the value of for the potential inaccuracy in this property value.
IMAP does not mandate that the server keep the client updated with this value while a mailbox is selected but it also disallows retrieving the value for a mailbox while the mailbox is selected.

While the associated mailbox is selected the library internally maintains the value of this property by monitoring IMAP FETCH responses from the server, but these responses have to be explicitly requested.
If it is important to you that the value of this property be accurate when the associated mailbox is selected then you must fetch the for new messages as they arrive.
See , and .

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.UIDNextUnknownCount
member.summary: Gets the number of messages that have arrived since the associated mailbox was selected for which the library has not seen the value of the UID. Indicates how inaccurate the is.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.UIDValidity
member.summary: Gets the UIDValidity of the associated mailbox. May be null (see ). This property always has a value when the associated mailbox is selected; however a value of 0 indicates that the server does not support UIDs.
member.remarks: Null indicates that the associated mailbox does not support UIDs or that the is not being cached (see ) or that the value was not sent when requested.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.UnseenCount
member.summary: Gets the number of unseen messages in the mailbox. May be null (see ). This property always has a value when the mailbox is selected, but it may not be up-to-date.

remarks.para: Null indicates that is not being cached (see ) or that the value was not sent when requested.
While the associated mailbox is selected the value of this property may not be up-to-date: see the value of for the potential inaccuracy in this property value.
IMAP does not provide a mechanism for getting this value while a mailbox is selected.

While the associated mailbox is selected the library internally maintains the value of this property by monitoring IMAP FETCH responses from the server, but the property value has to be explicitly initialised and the FETCH responses have to be explicitly requested.

If it is important to you that the value of this property be accurate when the associated mailbox is selected then you must initialise the value by using and also fetch the for new messages as they arrive.
See , and .

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.UnseenUnknownCount
member.summary: Gets the number of messages for which the library is unsure of the value of the flag. Indicates how inaccurate the is.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.HighestModSeq
member.summary: Gets the modification sequence number for the associated mailbox. See RFC 7162. May be null (see ). When the associated mailbox is selected this property will always have a value but it could be 0.

remarks.para: Null indicates that is not being cached (see ) or that the value was not sent when requested.
0 indicates that is not supported on the associated mailbox.

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.UIDStore(work.bacome.imapclient.cUID,work.bacome.imapclient.eStoreOperation,work.bacome.imapclient.cStorableFlags,System.Nullable{System.UInt64})
member.summary: Stores flags for a message. The associated mailbox must be selected.
member.param: The type of store operation.

The modseq to use in the UNCHANGEDSINCE clause of a conditional store (see RFC 7162). Can only be specified if the associated mailbox supports CONDSTORE. If the message has been modified since the specified modseq the server should fail the update.
member.returns: Feedback on the success (or otherwise) of the store.

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.UIDStoreAsync(work.bacome.imapclient.cUID,work.bacome.imapclient.eStoreOperation,work.bacome.imapclient.cStorableFlags,System.Nullable{System.UInt64})
member.summary: Asynchronously stores flags for a message. The associated mailbox must be selected.
member.param: The type of store operation.

The modseq to use in the UNCHANGEDSINCE clause of a conditional store (see RFC 7162). Can only be specified if the associated mailbox supports CONDSTORE. If the message has been modified since the specified modseq the server should fail the update.
member.returns: Feedback on the success (or otherwise) of the store.

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.UIDStore(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{work.bacome.imapclient.cUID},work.bacome.imapclient.eStoreOperation,work.bacome.imapclient.cStorableFlags,System.Nullable{System.UInt64})
member.summary: Stores flags for a set of messages. The associated mailbox must be selected.
member.param: The type of store operation.

The modseq to use in the UNCHANGEDSINCE clause of a conditional store (see RFC 7162). Can only be specified if the associated mailbox supports CONDSTORE. If any of the messages have been modified since the specified modseq the server should fail the update to that message.
member.returns: Feedback on the success (or otherwise) of the store.

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cMailbox.UIDStoreAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{work.bacome.imapclient.cUID},work.bacome.imapclient.eStoreOperation,work.bacome.imapclient.cStorableFlags,System.Nullable{System.UInt64})

The modseq to use in the UNCHANGEDSINCE clause of a conditional store (see RFC 7162). Can only be specified if the associated mailbox supports CONDSTORE. If any of the messages have been modified since the specified modseq the server should fail the update to that message.
member.returns: Feedback on the success (or otherwise) of the store.

member.name: T:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage
member.summary: Provides an API that allows interaction with an IMAP message.
member.remarks: Instances are only valid whilst the containing mailbox remains selected. Re-selecting a mailbox will not bring the message instances back to life. Instances are only valid whilst the containing mailbox has the same UIDValidity.

member.summary: The client that this instance was created by.

member.summary: The internal message cache item that this instance is attached to.

member.name: E:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Fired when the server notifies the client of a message property value change. Most properties of an IMAP message can never change.

remarks.para: If is non-null, events are fired on the specified .
If an exception is raised in an event handler the event is raised, but otherwise the exception is ignored.

member.summary: Gets and sets flag of the message. When getting the value, if the internal message cache does not contain the flags of the message, they will be fetched from the server.

member.summary: Adds the flag to the message flags.

member.summary: Determines if the contain the flag. If the internal message cache does not contain flags for the message, they will be fetched from the server.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.Received
member.summary: Gets the IMAP INTERNALDATE of the message. If the internal message cache does not contain the internal date of the message, it will be fetched from the server.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.Size
member.summary: Gets the size of the entire message in bytes. If the internal message cache does not contain the size of the message, it will be fetched from the server.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.UID
member.summary: Gets the IMAP UID of the message. If the internal message cache does not contain the UID of the message, it will be fetched from the server. May be null if the server does not support unique identifiers.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.ModSeq
member.summary: Gets the modification sequence number of the message. If the internal message cache does not contain a modseq for the message, it will be fetched from the server. Will be 0 if the mailbox does not support CONDSTORE.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.BodyStructure
member.summary: Gets the IMAP BODYSTRUCTURE of the message. If the internal message cache does not contain the body structure of the message, it will be fetched from the server.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.Attachments
member.summary: Gets the list of message attachments. If the internal message cache does not contain the body structure of the message, it will be fetched from the server. The returned list may be empty.
member.remarks: The library defines an attachment as a message part with a disposition of attachment. If there are alternate versions of an attachment only one of the alternates is included in the returned list (the first one).

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.PlainTextSizeInBytes
member.summary: Gets the size in bytes of the plain text parts of the message. If the internal message cache does not contain the body structure of the message, it will be fetched from the server. May be zero.
member.remarks: The library defines plain text parts as parts with a MIME type of text/plain and without a disposition of 'attachment'. If there are alternate versions of a part only one of the alternates is used in calculating the size (the first one).

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.References
member.summary: Gets the normalised (delimiters, quoting, comments and white space removed) message-ids from the references header field. If the internal message cache does not contain the references header field of the message, it will be fetched from the server. May be null.
member.remarks: May be null if there is no references header field or if the references header field can not be parsed by the library.

member.name: P:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.Importance

member.name: M:work.bacome.imapclient.cMessage.PlainText
member.summary: Fetches the message's plain text parts from the server, decoding if required, and concatenates them yielding the returned value. If the internal message cache does not contain the bodystructure of the message, it will be fetched from the server.
member.remarks: The library defines plain text parts as parts with a MIME type of text/plain and without a disposition of 'attachment'. If there are alternate versions of a part only one of the alternates is used in generating the plain text (the first one).

member.name: T:work.bacome.async.cExclusiveAccess
member.summary: Instances provide a mechanism to control exclusive access using token objects and block objects.

remarks.para: The granting of exclusive access is done by issuing a token object. To release the exclusive access the token object must be disposed.
The issuing of token objects may be blocked by the previous issue of block objects. Several block objects can be on issue at the same time. Blocks are released by disposing the block objects.
Block objects will not be issued while a token object is issued. Token objects will not be issued while block objects are issued (nor while a token object is issued).
Instance sequence numbers (specified in the constructor) can be used by external code to ensure that the program's locks are being taken in a consistent order (to avoid deadlocks).
Each instance of this class is allocated a unique instance number internally that is used in messages to aid debugging.
Note that this class implements , so you should dispose instances when you are finished with them.

member.summary: Instances coordinate tasks (one worker task and many work creating tasks) using internal coordinating tasks.

remarks.para:

Call the method to indicate that it is about to start working.
Check for and do all the work available.
Awair on the task returned by .

member.name: T:work.bacome.trace.cTrace
member.summary: Instances wrap a and provide services to write trace messages with indenting and context information.

remarks.para: The concept is that trace messages are written in a context. The context starts with independent root-contexts. Sub-contexts can be established within root-contexts and within other sub-contexts.
If a new sub-context is created for each call then call stack information can be built and included in the trace.

The writing of context trace messages can be delayed until a non-context trace message is written, or context trace messages can be written as the contexts are created. (Note however that if the writing is delayed then the generation of the context trace messages is also delayed. If there are mutable objects to be included in the context trace message then this may lead to misleading context trace messages. It is done like this for efficiency reasons.)

Tracing can be disabled. When tracing is disabled contexts are not created and trace messages are not emitted, so most of the tracing overhead is eliminated. Tracing is disabled under the following circumstances;
The assembly is compiled without the "TRACE" conditional attribute.
There aren't any listeners attached to the when the instance is created.
The isn't configured to emit critical messages when the instance is created.
The context is used.
Root-contexts have a name and a number. The name is programmer assigned, the number is internally assigned and is unique.
Trace messages are indented by a number of spaces that equals the context stack depth.

Trace messages are written in a tab delimited form, the tab delimited columns contain;
The defined data.
The date and time that the message was written.
The name and number of the root-context associated with the trace message.
The thread number on which the trace message was written.
The space indented trace message.

member.param: The name to use.
